author: (Foto: MoisÃ©s Pablo Nava/Cuartoscuro.)
title: AMLO ante presunta filtraciÃ³n de la DEA: si EU no tiene pruebas, que se disculpe
text:
El presidente AndrÃ©s Manuel LÃ³pez Obrador pidiÃ³ al gobierno de Estados Unidos manifestarse sobre el dinero que presuntamente recibiÃ³ del narcotrÃ¡fico su campaÃ±a a la presidencia de la RepÃºblica del aÃ±o 2006 y, en caso de ser necesario, presentar pruebas o disculparse.
"Yo lo que quiero es que el gobierno de Estados Unidos se manifieste porque el presidente de MÃ©xico tiene autoridad moral y tiene autoridad polÃ­tica y, sino tienen pruebas, tienen que disculparse", planteÃ³ este jueves el presidente.
Publicidad La peticiÃ³n para que Estados Unidos se manifieste surge luego de la publicaciÃ³n del reportaje Â¿Narcotraficantes canalizaron millones de dÃ³lares a la primera campaÃ±a del presidente mexicano LÃ³pez Obrador?, en el cual se seÃ±ala que testigos revelaron a la DEA que la primera campaÃ±a presidencial de AndrÃ©s Manuel LÃ³pez Obrador presuntamente recibiÃ³ dos millones dÃ³lares, a cambio de que durante su eventual gobierno se toleraran las operaciones del cÃ¡rtel.
LÃ³pez Obrador pidiÃ³ que su homÃ³logo Joe Biden se pronuncie al respecto, de lo contrario, dijo que es difÃ­cil estar sentados en la misma mesa de negociaciÃ³n.
â€œEl presidente Biden deberÃ­a de enterarse de esto. Â¿CÃ³mo vamos a estar sentados en la mesa hablando del combate a la droga, si ellos, o una instituciÃ³n de ellos estÃ¡ filtrando informaciÃ³n y daÃ±Ã¡ndome, no a mÃ­, a lo que represento. Entonces, Â¿cÃ³mo vamos a estar hablando de migraciÃ³n y vamos a estar hablando de combate a la droga y del fentanilo?", comentÃ³.
Te recomendamos: presidencia "Si tienen pruebas, presÃ©ntenlas", dice AMLO a quienes lo vinculan con el narco El mandatario mexicano considerÃ³ como una calumnia el reportaje de Tom Golden y dijo que la publicaciÃ³n se da en periodo electoral.
â€œEs como ahora este periodista que sacÃ³ el reportaje de que yo estoy metido en el narcotrÃ¡fico, me dieron dinero para la campaÃ±a, sin presentar una sola prueba. Y es periodista famoso, de los premiados... para mÃ­ tienen que darle el premio a la calumnia, es un mercenario al servicio de la DEA; Â¿cÃ³mo va a calumniar?â€, indicÃ³ el mandatario.
Publicidad Lo Ãºltimo El gobierno impugnarÃ¡ revÃ©s a la Ley ElÃ©ctrica; AMLO anuncia reforma energÃ©tica Sheinbaum rechaza vÃ­nculos de AMLO con narco: "No hacemos pactos con criminales" Â¿AMLO a la sombra del narco?: acusaciones como candidato y presidente lo siguen Publicidad Sin embargo, el presidente considerÃ³ que detrÃ¡s del reportaje estÃ¡ la Agencia Antidrogas de Estados Unidos y el Departamento de Justicia.
â€œEl periodista este, de repente considerÃ³ que era importante hacer un reportaje en estas fechas electorales en MÃ©xico, Â¿de pura casualidad? AquÃ­ es como se decÃ­a antes, Â¿de parte de quiÃ©n?â€, agregÃ³.
Conoce mÃ¡s: presidencia Â¿AMLO a la sombra del narco?: acusaciones como candidato y presidente lo siguen LÃ³pez Obrador considerÃ³ que aunque se declarÃ³ un asunto cerrado, es importante que el gobierno de Estados se pronuncie porque este tipo de informaciÃ³n â€œmanchanâ€ su nombre.
â€œÂ¿CuÃ¡les son las pruebas?, Â¿dÃ³nde estÃ¡n las pruebas? Es la mÃ¡xima del hampa del periodismo: que la calumnia cuando no mancha, tiznaâ€, subrayÃ³.
Elecciones 2024 El Circo ðŸŽª| Carpa guinda multada, emisaria del Bitcoin y espejo en CDMX UtopÃ­as de Clara Brugada son promocionadas en bardas y Metro de la CDMX Asesinan a precandidato del Verde a alcalde del municipio de Mascota, Jalisco ver mÃ¡s Publicidad Publicidad Tags AMLO Presidencia NarcotrÃ¡fico Estados conferencia maÃ±anera Recomendaciones presidencia "Es calumnia", dice AMLO de presunta financiaciÃ³n del narco a su campaÃ±a de 2006 4 Min Read MÃ¡s acerca del autor: Lidia Arista @ExpansionMx MGID Recomienda Newsletter

author: Lennart Schwenck
title: â€žGeschmacklos": MÃ¼ller-Produkt stÃ¶ÃŸt Kundin auf - Drogeriemarkt zieht Konsequenzen
text:
â€žGeschmacklosâ€œ: MÃ¼ller-Produkt stÃ¶ÃŸt Kundin auf â€“ Drogeriemarkt zieht Konsequenzen
Eine MÃ¼ller-Kundin findet ein anzÃ¼gliches Modellbau-Set in der Spielwarenabteilung. Der Drogeriemarkt reagiert prompt. Auch der Hersteller Ã¤uÃŸert sich.
MÃ¼nchen â€“ Ein unscheinbares Modellbau-Set erregt aktuell viel Aufsehen: Das Figuren-Set â€žVoyeureâ€œ der Firma NOCH aus Wangen im AllgÃ¤u zeigt halbnackte Frauen, einen Mann mit Fernglas â€“ und ein Kind, das sich die Augen zuhÃ¤lt. Es ist Teil einer Produktreihe fÃ¼r Modelleisenbahn-Landschaften. Das eigentlich unauffÃ¤llige Set aus dem Standardsortiment wurde zum Zentrum einer hitzigen Debatte Ã¼ber Geschmack, Ethik und die Grenzen der Miniaturdarstellung.
AuslÃ¶ser fÃ¼r den Wirbel war eine Beschwerde: Christine B. entdeckte das Set in der Spielwarenabteilung einer MÃ¼ller-Filiale in MÃ¼nchen. GegenÃ¼ber Bild kritisierte sie: â€žHier wird Voyeurismus verharmlost und Kindern als harmlose Unterhaltung vermittelt.â€œ FÃ¼r sie sei das â€žnicht nur geschmacklos, sondern auch hÃ¶chst verantwortungslos.â€œ
Figuren-Set verschwindet nach Beschwerde von Kundin aus dem MÃ¼ller-Sortiment
Der Drogeriemarkt MÃ¼ller reagierte prompt. Ein Sprecher des Unternehmens erklÃ¤rte gegenÃ¼ber der BILD-Zeitung: â€žBeim Handelskonzern MÃ¼ller legen wir grÃ¶ÃŸten Wert auf ein verantwortungsvolles und familienfreundliches Sortiment. [â€¦] Die betreffenden Artikel wurden umgehend entfernt.â€œ Man bedaure den Vorfall sehr und prÃ¼fe derzeit, wie Ã¤hnliche Fehler in Zukunft vermieden werden kÃ¶nnten. Das Figuren-Set ist mittlerweile aus dem Sortiment und Online-Handel entfernt worden.
Die Firma Noch GmbH, ein traditionsreiches Familienunternehmen mit 114-jÃ¤hriger Geschichte und europÃ¤ischer MarktfÃ¼hrerschaft im Bereich ModellbauzubehÃ¶r, zeigt sich angesichts der EmpÃ¶rung gelassen. GeschÃ¤ftsfÃ¼hrer Rainer Noch erklÃ¤rte gegenÃ¼ber dem SWR: â€žDie Verkaufszahlen haben am Dienstagmorgen schon deutlich angezogen.â€œ Er rechne damit, dass das Set bald ausverkauft sein werde. Dass gerade dieses Figuren-Set fÃ¼r Diskussionen sorgt, verwundert Noch: â€žDie RealitÃ¤t kennt keine Tabus, und um ein wirklichkeitsnahes Abbild zu schaffen, ist es notwendig, auch jene Aspekte darzustellen, die zum menschlichen Leben gehÃ¶ren.â€œ Das Set sei seit Jahren im Sortiment und habe bislang kaum Kritik ausgelÃ¶st.
Hersteller Ã¤uÃŸert sich: â€žWir wollen das Leben in all seinen Facetten darstellenâ€œ
Das Set â€žVoyeureâ€œ ist Teil einer Linie von Miniaturfiguren, mit denen Noch laut eigener Website â€žhumorvolle oder ungewÃ¶hnliche Szenenâ€œ darstellen will. Im Online-Shop wird es als geeignet fÃ¼r â€žerotische Szenen in Ihrer Modelllandschaftsgestaltungâ€œ beworben. Die Figuren sind Ã¼bliche Miniaturfiguren, wie man sie zum Beispiel aus dem Miniaturwunderland in Hamburg kennt. WÃ¤hrend kritische Stimmen, wie die von Christine B., das Set als sexualisierte Darstellung mit problematischer Botschaft einstufen, betont der Hersteller seine kÃ¼nstlerische und realitÃ¤tsnahe Freiheit. â€žWir wollen das Leben in all seinen Facetten darstellen,â€œ sagte Rainer Noch gegenÃ¼ber dem SWR.
Die Aufmerksamkeit ist fÃ¼r das Unternehmen aus dem AllgÃ¤u offenbar kein Nachteil. Bereits auf der Spielwarenmesse in NÃ¼rnberg prÃ¤sentierte die Noch GmbH eine neue Linie namens â€žFunny-Scenesâ€œ, die Sets mit Bezeichnungen wie â€žSaufbrÃ¼derâ€œ, â€žSeitensprungâ€œ oder â€žStraÃŸenstrichâ€œ umfasst. Diese sollen ab Oktober im Handel erhÃ¤ltlich sein. Das, was der eine lustig findet, dem anderen sauer aufstÃ¶ÃŸt, ist keine Seltenheit. So erhiet etwa auch ein Mafia-Brettspiel heftigen Gegenwind. (ls)

author: WATN Local Memphis
title: MSCS Board approves nearly $2 billion budget for next school year - NewsBreak
text:
Memphis
MSCS Board approves nearly $2 billion budget for next school year
5 hours ago
MEMPHIS, Tenn. â€” The Memphis-Shelby County School Board approved a $1.9 billion operating budget during a special board meeting called on Wednesday, June 11, specifically to vote on the fiscal year 2025-26 budget. Board members will be able to make amendments to the budget through June 30 before it...

author: @Dailyhuntapp
title: World 10K Bengaluru 2024 draws record participation
text:
The World's Premier 10K will witness over 28,000+ participants take to the start line at the Cubbon Road outside Field Marshal Sam Manekshaw Parade Ground. Furthermore, 1500+ runners will also participate virtually from different parts of the world through the exclusive World 10K Bengaluru event App.
Cheering on the participants will be legendary shot putter Valerie Adams, a four-time World Champion and two-time Olympic medallist, and the events' International Event Ambassador.
The World 10K Bengaluru saw an overwhelming response from the running community across all categories, breaking all barriers. Registrations for the feature race - the Open 10K and the Majja Run are over-subscribed. This is a glowing testament to the popularity of the sport of running. Today, running is the fastest-growing urban sport, and as many as 700 new runners are inspired each day to begin their running journey.
Sunil Deshpande regional head of TCS Bengaluru, said, "The response from the running community to the 16th edition of the TCS World 10K Bengaluru has been phenomenal. The passion and dedication displayed by the runners as they come together to push their boundaries and showcase incredible endurance is truly inspiring. As a leading global IT services provider, we are committed to enhancing the race experience through technology to leave a lasting impression on the runners. We are truly excited to welcome our runners, who embody the spirit of resilience and determination that makes this event so special. Our best wishes to all participants, eagerly waiting to see them on race day."
The 2024 edition of the World Athletics Gold Label Race promises an enhanced experience for all participants. With support from the Indian Army, Karnataka & Kerala Sub Area, Field Marshal Sam Manekshaw Parade Ground is the new home for the World 10K Bengaluru.
The pre-race venue for all runners is Rajendra Sinhji Army Officers Institute (RSAOI) and post-race engagements are at Field Marshal Sam Manekshaw Parade Ground. Runners across categories - 10K (Open & Elite), Majja Run, Champions with Disability and the Silvers' Run will congregate at the iconic Field Marshal Sam Manekshaw Parade Ground and take off on a scenic journey that winds past Bengaluru's famous landmarks.
The Indian elite women's line-up will feature the defending champion Tamshi Singh and Sanjivani Jadhav, a two-time champion and event record holder with a time of 33:38 set in 2018. While last year's runner-up, Harmanjot Singh, will compete again in the men's category.
The World's Premier 10K, with a total prize money of USD 210,000, has attracted some of the leading Indian and international athletes along with amateur runners from across the globe. Winners in the Indian Men's and Women's categories will be awarded INR 2,75,000 each. Furthermore, a record-breaking feat could see them take home an additional INR 2,00,000 thanks to the combined event record bonus and jackpot.
Disclaimer: This post has been auto-published from an agency feed without any modifications to the text and has not been reviewed by an editor

author: @azfamily
title: Tempe bar sells shirts comparing underage drinking raid to 9/11 attacks
text:
Tempe bar sells shirts comparing underage drinking raid to 9/11 attacks
TEMPE, AZ (AZFamily) â€” A Tempe bar that was the scene of nearly 200 underage drinking arrests last week is now memorializing the raid with a controversial t-shirt. Theyâ€™re comparing it to 9/11.
Arizona State University students tell Arizonaâ€™s Family that the bust at Tempe Tavern is no surprise. Still, most of them say they are frustrated by the crackdown, which is getting in the way of having a good time.
The t-shirts are a bit more divisive. Some of the college kids say theyâ€™re a harmless joke and good marketing for the bar, while others call them insensitive and a downright disgrace.
Tempe Tavern is a popular spot for college kids.
â€œItâ€™s really, really fun,â€ said Hannah Webster, a junior at ASU.
â€œThe reputation there is booze is cheap and music is good,â€ said Aiden Sweetman, an ASU freshman.
The bar is near ASUâ€™s Tempe campus off McClintock and Apache, but last Thursday night, it was crawling with police officers.
â€œYou seriously have nothing better to do than ruin our fun?â€ said Webster. â€œItâ€™s really upsetting that Tempe PD has literally nothing better to do with their time.â€
â€œItâ€™s probably one of the two bars that any kid under the age of 21 can go to,â€ said Adrian Suljuzopse, an ASU freshman.
The Arizona Department of Liquor Licenses and Control teamed up with Tempe police and arrested 173 people for underage drinking there.
The operation was in response to multiple complaints Tempe PD received about this bar letting in people under 21.
â€œSame thing when they do speed traps to get people speeding, if youâ€™re not speeding youâ€™re not the problem. If youâ€™re underage, your fault. You shouldnâ€™t have been drinking,â€ said Sweetman. â€œThis was just dumb college kids getting arrested.â€
Not long after the raid, Tempe Tavern posted on Facebook about selling t-shirts that say #TavernStrong and â€œour 9/11.â€
â€œItâ€™s definitely an interesting joke. Personally I think itâ€™s kinda funny,â€ said Suljuzopse.
â€œI just think itâ€™s gross. Thatâ€™s my only word for it. I think itâ€™s gross and I think itâ€™s really inappropriate,â€ said Webster.
â€œItâ€™s more so breaking the law and getting caught and not so much so the devastation on 9/11,â€ said Sweetman. â€œItâ€™s definitely not something to joke about.â€
Tempe Tavernâ€™s social media post says, â€œThey hit the second tower.â€
ASU students said they think thatâ€™s about another well-known bar closing recently: Devilâ€™s Advocate shut down in December after a real estate deal.
â€œNow that they closed, all of the traffic that was going to Devilâ€™s is going to Tavern and I think thatâ€™s partially responsible for why that raid happened in the first place,â€ said Suljuzopse.
An official with the Arizona Department of Liquor Licenses and Control said Tempe Tavern did have a bouncer checking IDs that night, but many were fake.
The agency is now completing an administrative review of the bar to determine whether the owners should face any repercussions, such as a fine or license suspension.
Records show Tempe Tavern has several violations involving serving underage people and accepting fake IDs. Some of these violations were as recent as last month and have resulted in thousands of dollars in fines but never a license suspensionâ€”a rare consequence.
Arizonaâ€™s Family stopped by the bar, and no one there wanted to comment on the raid or t-shirts.
See a spelling or grammatical error in our story? Please click here to report it.
Do you have a photo or video of a breaking news story? Send it to us here with a brief description.

author: Guest
title: More than 40 students receive GED diplomas
text:
Forty-one individuals received their high school diploma through the GED program at Central Community College between Jan. 1 and June 30.
CCC offers the GED program at its Columbus, Grand Island and Hastings campuses and Holdrege, Kearney, Lexington and Ord centers as well as remotely across its service area.
Graduates are:
CAIRO: Anny Zeller
CEDAR RAPIDS: Angela Torres
CENTRAL CITY: Shelbi Nelson
CLAY CENTER: Camille Clang
COLUMBUS: John Delgado, Yecy Fonseca Sosa, Brock Grube, Carlos Mendoza II, Karla Ochoa Castillo, Salvador Oseguera Rios, Leonardo Rivera Garcia, Juan Sanchez, Oslay Ulloa Perez and Roberto Vilchis Lemus.
People are also readingâ€¦
COZAD: Malaky Refior
GOTHENBURG: Dorette Hattingh
GRAND ISLAND: Maria Getzari Arteaga Ballesteros, Giovanni Bocanegra, Gabriela Borjas Chacon, Carlos Fernandez Pirez, Linsy Galvez Moreno, Kailie Hostetler, Alondra Munoz, Maria Orozco, Michel Ramirez Reyes and Isaac Santoyo Meza
HASTINGS: Emily Garcia, AnnMarie Gilbert, Micah Goldsmith, Teniesha Kuhn, Brandon Lintz, Isidro Lopez Villamil, Jonathan Olinger and Angela Young Jr.
HOLSTEIN: Judah Troxell
KEARNEY: Jennifer Cowins, Nevaeh Moore and Brianna Phelps
NELSON: Kerri Rennick
ORLEANS: Christopher Shada
SCHUYLER: Amna Osman
